SEARCH
Package civitas.celestis.math.vector

Class Quaternion

java.lang.Object
civitas.celestis.math.vector.Vector4
civitas.celestis.math.vector.Quaternion
All Implemented Interfaces:
DoubleVector<Vector4>, Vector<Double,Vector4>, Collectable<Double>, Listable<Double>, Groupable<Double>, Transformable<Double>, Serializable
public class Quaternion extends Vector4
A specialized four-dimensional vector which is mostly used to represent the rotation, or rate of rotation of three-dimensional vectors.
See Also:
  • Serialized Form

  • Field Details

    • IDENTITY

      public static final Quaternion IDENTITY
      The identity quaternion. This produces no rotation.

  • Constructor Details

    • Quaternion

      public Quaternion(double w, double x, double y, double z)
      Creates a new quaternion.
      Parameters:
      w - The W component of this quaternion
      x - The X component of this quaternion
      y - The Y component of this quaternion
      z - The Z component of this quaternion

    • Quaternion

      public Quaternion(@Nonnull double[] values)
      Creates a new quaternion.
      Parameters:
      values - An array containing the values of this quaternion in WXYZ order

    • Quaternion

      public Quaternion(double s, @Nonnull Vector3 v)
      Creates a new quaternion.
      Parameters:
      s - The scalar part (the W component) of this quaternion
      v - The vector part (the XYZ components) of this quaternion

    • inverse

      @Nonnull public Quaternion inverse() throws ArithmeticException
      Returns the inverse of this quaternion. If an inverse cannot be derived (this quaternion has a Euclidean norm of zero), this will throw an ArithmeticException.
      Returns:
      The inverse of this quaternion
      Throws:
      ArithmeticException - When the Euclidean norm of this quaternion is zero

    • multiply

      @Nonnull public Quaternion multiply(@Nonnull Vector4 v)
      Performs quaternion left-multiplication. This operation accepts any Vector4 as its parameter, but treats it as if it were a quaternion.
      Overrides:
      multiply in class Vector4
      Parameters:
      v - The vector of which to get the quaternion product between
      Returns:
      The quaternion left-product between the two values

    • scale

      @Nonnull public Quaternion scale(double s)
      Scales the rotation of this quaternion. This will only work properly if this quaternion is a rotation quaternion. (a quaternion with a Euclidean norm of 1)
      Parameters:
      s - The scale factor to apply to the rotation
      Returns:
      The scaled quaternion

    • negate

      @Nonnull public Quaternion negate()
      Returns a negated vector which has the same magnitude, but faces the opposing direction.
      Specified by:
      negate in interface Vector<Double,Vector4>
      Overrides:
      negate in class Vector4
      Returns:
      The negation of this vector

    • normalize

      @Nonnull public Quaternion normalize() throws ArithmeticException
      Normalizes this vector to have a magnitude of 1. If this vector has a magnitude of zero, this will throw an ArithmeticException.
      Specified by:
      normalize in interface Vector<Double,Vector4>
      Overrides:
      normalize in class Vector4
      Returns:
      The normalized vector of this vector
      Throws:
      ArithmeticException - When the magnitude of this vector is zero, and thus cannot be normalized to have a magnitude of 1

    • normalizeOrZero

      @Nonnull public Quaternion normalizeOrZero()
      Normalizes this vector to have a magnitude of 1. If this vector has a magnitude of zero, meaning every component of this vector is zero, this will return itself.
      Specified by:
      normalizeOrZero in interface Vector<Double,Vector4>
      Overrides:
      normalizeOrZero in class Vector4
      Returns:
      The normalized vector of this vector if normalization is possible, a reference to this vector itself if not

    • min

      @Nonnull public Quaternion min(@Nonnull Vector4 v)
      Between this vector and the provided boundary vector, this will return the minimum vector. This is achieved by taking the minimum of each corresponding component, then packaging the components into a new vector.
      Specified by:
      min in interface Vector<Double,Vector4>
      Overrides:
      min in class Vector4
      Parameters:
      v - The boundary vector to respect
      Returns:
      The minimum vector between the two vectors

    • max

      @Nonnull public Quaternion max(@Nonnull Vector4 v)
      Between this vector and the provided minimum boundary vector, this will return the maximum vector. This is achieved by taking the maximum of each corresponding component, then packaging the components into a new vector.
      Specified by:
      max in interface Vector<Double,Vector4>
      Overrides:
      max in class Vector4
      Parameters:
      v - The boundary vector to respect
      Returns:
      The maximum vector between the two vectors

    • clamp

      @Nonnull public Quaternion clamp(@Nonnull Vector4 min, @Nonnull Vector4 max)
      Clamps this vector to fit between the range of [min, max]. This is achieved by clamping each corresponding component, then packaging the clamped components into a new vector.
      Specified by:
      clamp in interface Vector<Double,Vector4>
      Overrides:
      clamp in class Vector4
      Parameters:
      min - The minimum boundary vector
      max - The maximum boundary vector
      Returns:
      The clamped vector which respects the range of [min, max]

    • transform

      @Nonnull public Quaternion transform(@Nonnull Function<? super Double,Double> f)
      Applies the provided function f to all elements of this object, then returns the transformed object. If this object has a specified order, the order will remain intact.
      Specified by:
      transform in interface Transformable<Double>
      Overrides:
      transform in class Vector4
      Parameters:
      f - The function to apply to each element of this object
      Returns:
